body:
### Problem

Executing `:packadd!` with 'pack/*/opt' plugins intentionally updates 'runtimepath' value. However, it does so in a way that later prompts for reparsing and recaching of 'runtimepath' value ([here](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/c28113dd9d09b661061d25c147e39efadc6e700b/src/nvim/runtime.c#L656), I believe). Since `:packadd!` already knows how to insert entries into 'runtimepath' value, it might be reasonable for it to also more directly update the parsed/cached value.

---

The current behavior has visible performance downsides when using with `vim.pack.add`. Here is how to reproduce them:

1. Create a separate config directory (like '~/.config/nvim-packadd-bench').
2. Inside of it, add the 'setup-plugins.lua' file that sets up many similar plugins to later be `:packadd!`ed:

    <details><summary>Contents of 'setup-plugins.lua'</summary>

    ```lua
    local create_plugin = function(name, path)
      local cmd = name:sub(1, 1):upper() .. name:sub(2)

      -- 'lua/' module
      local lua_lines = {
        string.format('local run = function() _G.value = "%s" end', cmd),
        string.format('local config = function() _G.%s = { "%s" } end', name, cmd),
        'return { config = config, run = run }',
      }

      vim.fn.mkdir(vim.fs.joinpath(path, 'lua'), 'p')
      vim.fn.writefile(lua_lines, vim.fs.joinpath(path, 'lua', name .. '.lua'))

      -- 'plugin/' script
      local plugin_lines = {
        -- Define one user command
        string.format('vim.api.nvim_create_user_command("%s", function() require("%s").run() end, {})', cmd, name),
        -- Define one `<Plug>` keymap
        string.format('vim.keymap.set("n", "<Plug>(%s)", function() require("%s").run() end)', cmd, name),
      }

      vim.fn.mkdir(vim.fs.joinpath(path, 'plugin'), 'p')
      vim.fn.writefile(plugin_lines, vim.fs.joinpath(path, 'plugin', name .. '.lua'))
    end

    local pack_path = vim.fs.joinpath(vim.fn.stdpath('config'), 'pack', 'demo', 'opt')
    vim.fn.mkdir(pack_path, 'p')

    local n_plugins = 10
    for i = 1, n_plugins do
      local name = string.format('plugin%02d', i)
      local path = vim.fs.joinpath(pack_path, name)
      create_plugin(name, path)
    end
    ```

    </details>

3. Run `NVIM_APPNAME=nvim-packadd-bench nvim -l setup-plugins.lua`.
4. Create an 'init.lua' file for "grouped `:packadd`" config:

    ```lua
    for i = 1, 10 do
      vim.cmd('packadd! plugin' .. string.format('%02d', i))
    end

    for i = 1, 10 do
      require('plugin' .. string.format('%02d', i)).config()
    end
    ```
5. Run `NVIM_APPNAME=nvim-packadd-bench nvim --startuptime startup-grouped`.
6. Replace content of 'init.lua' with "separate `:packadd`" config:

    ```lua
    for i = 1, 10 do
      vim.cmd('packadd! plugin' .. string.format('%02d', i))
      require('plugin' .. string.format('%02d', i)).config()
    end
    ```
7. Run `NVIM_APPNAME=nvim-packadd-bench nvim --startuptime startup-separate`.
8. Observe difference in `require` times for "grouped" and "separate" configs:
    8.1. Excerpt from `startup-grouped`:

        ```
        005.447  000.243  000.243: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        005.676  000.225  000.225: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        005.898  000.214  000.214: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        006.119  000.218  000.218: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        006.331  000.209  000.209: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        006.559  000.225  000.225: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        006.795  000.232  000.232: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        007.023  000.222  000.222: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        007.239  000.213  000.213: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        007.473  000.230  000.230: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        007.973  000.497  000.497: require('plugin01')
        008.070  000.094  000.094: require('plugin02')
        008.143  000.072  000.072: require('plugin03')
        008.205  000.058  000.058: require('plugin04')
        008.258  000.052  000.052: require('plugin05')
        008.300  000.039  000.039: require('plugin06')
        008.335  000.035  000.035: require('plugin07')
        008.364  000.027  000.027: require('plugin08')
        008.388  000.022  000.022: require('plugin09')
        008.402  000.013  000.013: require('plugin10')
        008.403  003.227  000.087: sourcing /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua
        ```

    8.2. Excerpt from `startup-separate`:

        ```
        005.248  000.255  000.255: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        005.566  000.315  000.315: require('plugin01')
        005.787  000.217  000.217: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        006.106  000.316  000.316: require('plugin02')
        006.323  000.214  000.214: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        006.653  000.328  000.328: require('plugin03')
        006.877  000.221  000.221: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        007.204  000.324  000.324: require('plugin04')
        007.425  000.218  000.218: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        007.753  000.326  000.326: require('plugin05')
        007.966  000.210  000.210: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        008.320  000.351  000.351: require('plugin06')
        008.547  000.224  000.224: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        008.889  000.339  000.339: require('plugin07')
        009.102  000.211  000.211: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        009.449  000.344  000.344: require('plugin08')
        009.672  000.217  000.217: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        010.020  000.346  000.346: require('plugin09')
        010.246  000.223  000.223: sourcing nvim_exec2() called at /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua:0
        010.597  000.348  000.348: require('plugin10')
        010.599  005.629  000.083: sourcing /home/user/.config/nvim-packadd-bench/init.lua
        ```

Notice that in "grouped" case the first `require()` is somewhat slow, but next are very fast. This seems to be the effect of caching 'runtimepath' value. While in "separate" case all `require()` calls are somewhat slow with a tendency to slightly increase. This seems to be because each time it re-caches 'runtimepath' value and each time it is slightly larger than previous.

This all results in about 75% increase in 'init.lua' processing time. Although I would argue that "separate" case should be slightly faster here since each time `require()` only needs to traverse until the first 'pack/demo/opt' entry (since it is the latest one added closer to the start)

### Expected behavior

Executing `:packadd!` doesn't result in later reparsing and recaching of 'runtimepath' value. This would allow to recommend a more flexible usage of `vim.pack.add()`.

There seems to be a [TODO note](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/c28113dd9d09b661061d25c147e39efadc6e700b/src/nvim/runtime.c#L932-L933) for this sort of thing. @bfredl, I created this mostly to showcase the importance of this and for you to have something to benchmark against.

comment_data.body:
> Since `:packadd!` already knows how to insert entries into 'runtimepath' value, it might be reasonable for it to also more directly update the parsed/cached value.

Makes sense. Does it need to be in 0.12 though?
it is not a showstopper for 0.12, but I plan to work on it in time for release:)

> > Since `:packadd!` already knows how to insert entries into 'runtimepath' value, it might be reasonable for it to also more directly update the parsed/cached value.
> 
> Makes sense. Does it need to be in 0.12 though?

The reasoning is that it somewhat visibly affects how `vim.pack.add()` can be used. Right now suggesting several `vim.pack.add` calls (like in separate files) is tied with performance penalty. Although arguably it should be the other way around, assuming constant overhead from `vim.pack.add` call itself is small enough (which I *think* it is).

So indeed not a showstopper, but would be really nice to have.

I do not know if that fits in here, if not - I'm sorry in advance.

I do think there is a runtime issue going on with plugin fetching. I do not fully understand how i get to this:

I normally refresh my configs, removing/deleting all the plugins, and fetching a new config with something like:

```bash
nvrm () {
	local appname=$1 
	appname="${1:-nvim}" 
	rm -rf "${HOME}"/.local/{share,state}/"${appname}"
	NVIM_APPNAME="${appname}" nvim --headless +q
}
```

This should delete all the plugins from the neovim runtime. But when i then resource my config, i can see artifacts of colorschemes (maybe even plugins) that just do not live in my config anymore, but still they get installed when refetching, even though there is no entry for it in the config..

For reference, I'm on this version:
```
NVIM v0.12.0-dev-1858+g5f22cf5af3
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1765228720
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info
```

If that belongs into it's separate issue, please let me know.

> If that belongs into it's separate issue, please let me know.

My guess is that it is better to first create a [discussion](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/discussions/categories/q-a) about this and not an issue. As this probably has something to do with the actual config and not Neovim itself.
But if you can create a minimal 'init.lua' that doesn't use any outside plugins and can reliably reproduce the problem, then a separate issue would be better.

title: Make `:packadd!` not result into 'runtimepath' re-caching when using Lua's `require()`

type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality
type.name: Enhancement
